articles.title: About Me
articles.contents:
University of Michigan GraduationI spent a majority of my life in Michigan. Growing up, I used to find myself out in nature exploring. While I was in high school, I realized how humans are impacting the environment and knew that I wanted to do something to conserve it. During my undergraduate career at the University of Michigan, I found my home in the Environmental Science department. During my time there, I discovered interests in natural resource management, wildlife trade, and clean energy. Since arriving at Bren, I have been able to explore my interests more, as well as gain new skills involving environmental data science and Geographic Informational Systems.
Education and Career Interests
In 2021, I graduated from the University of Michigan with a Bachelor of Science in Environmental Science and a minor in Environmental Geology. At the university, I had many opportunities to expand my skill sets and learn more about my interests through classes and field work. Additionally, I partook in two research projects during my tenure at the university. The first research assignment I completed looked at how anthropogenic factors impact wetlands in urban versus rural areas. The other was in partner with the U.S. Geological Survey, where I worked alongside two fisheries scientists to determine the feasibility of creating two different bioenergetic models for Lake Trout (Salvelinus namaycush) - one model for each sex.
Also in 2021, I was accepted to the Bren School of Environmental Science & Management. My goal for attending is to further my education in the energy and climate field, where I hope to help aid the United States in a smoother transition to a renewable energy economy.
Hobbies
In my free time, I enjoy spending time with my family, friends, and pets. Additionally, I enjoy environmental photography, and have been learning how to take decent photos.
Top (from left): My sister, Sydney, and Me. Bottom (from left): My sister, Riley, and my brother, Hayden.Nichol’s Arboretum in Ann Arbor, MI. Credit: Kiera Matiska

            I am a first year master’s student at the Bren School of
            Environmental Science & Management at the University of
            California - Santa Barbara, specializing in Energy and
            Climate. I have strong interests around natural resource
            conservation and renewable energy transformation. I plan to
            focus on how social factors impact energy management.
